title: The Pragmatic Programmer
author: Andrew Hunt and David Thomas
description: The Pragmatic Programmer is a book about software development. It was first published in 1999 and has since been translated into over 20 languages. The book is based on the authors' experience as professional programmers and their belief that software development should be a creative and enjoyable process.

title: Steve Jobs
author: Walter Isaacson
description: Steve Jobs is a biography of Steve Jobs, the co-founder and former CEO of Apple Inc. The book was written by Walter Isaacson and published in 2011. The book was a critical and commercial success, and it was adapted into a 2015 film of the same name.

title: The Hitchhiker's Guide to the Galaxy
author: Douglas Adams
description: The Hitchhiker's Guide to the Galaxy is a comedy science fiction series created by Douglas Adams. The series follows the misadventures of hapless human Arthur Dent and his alien friend Ford Prefect as they travel through space and time.

title: The Lord of the Rings
author: J.R.R. Tolkien
description: The Lord of the Rings is an epic fantasy novel by J.R.R. Tolkien. The story follows hobbit Frodo Baggins as he and a fellowship of other creatures embark on a quest to destroy the One Ring, which was forged by the dark lord Sauron.

title: To Kill a Mockingbird
author: Harper Lee
description: To Kill a Mockingbird is a novel by Harper Lee that tells the story of a young girl named Scout Finch and her family in the fictional town of Maycomb, Alabama during the Great Depression. The novel was first published in 1960 and has become a classic of modern American literature.

title: Sapiens: A Brief History of Humankind
author: Yuval Noah Harari
description: Sapiens: A Brief History of Humankind is a book that explores the history of the human species from the emergence of Homo sapiens in Africa to the present day. The book was written by Yuval Noah Harari and was first published in Hebrew in 2011.

title: The Lean Startup
author: Eric Ries
description: The Lean Startup is a business book written by Eric Ries. The book was first published in 2011 and has since been translated into over 30 languages. The book is based on Ries's experience as a startup entrepreneur and his belief that there is a better way to build and run a business.

title: Dead Aid: Why Aid Is Not Working and How There Is a Better Way for Africa
author: Dambisa Moyo
description: In this book, Dambisa Moyo argues that foreign aid has not only failed to help Africa, but has actually hindered economic growth and fueled corruption. She presents evidence and arguments for why aid should be phased out and replaced with private investment and other forms of economic development.

title: Homo Deus: A Brief History of Tomorrow
author: Yuval Noah Harari
description: Homo Deus is a book that explores the future of human evolution, arguing that technology and biology are converging to create a new kind of human being. The book examines the challenges and opportunities that this new era presents, and raises important ethical questions about the role of technology in our lives.

title: Atomic Habits
author: James Clear
description: Learn how to build good habits, break bad ones, and master the tiny behaviors that lead to remarkable results.

title: The Subtle Art of Not Giving a F*ck
author: Mark Manson
description: A counterintuitive approach to living a good life by learning not to care about things that don't matter.

title: Untamed
author: Glennon Doyle
description: A memoir and self-help book that explores the author's journey to finding her true self and embracing her desires.

title: The Four Agreements
author: Don Miguel Ruiz
description: A practical guide to personal freedom and a powerful code of conduct based on ancient Toltec wisdom.

title: The Midnight Library
author: Matt Haig
description: A novel about a library between life and death, where a woman explores alternate versions of her life.

title: The Boy, the Mole, the Fox and the Horse
author: Charlie Mackesy
description: A heartwarming story of friendship and life's important lessons, featuring charming illustrations.

title: The Four Winds
author: Kristin Hannah
description: A novel set during the Great Depression, following a woman's journey to survive and find hope.

title: Verity
author: Colleen Hoover
description: A dark and intense romantic thriller involving a struggling writer and a mysterious author.

title: The Seven Husbands of Evelyn Hugo
author: Taylor Jenkins Reid
description: A fictional biography of a Hollywood icon, exploring her tumultuous love life and career.

title: The Guest List
author: Lucy Foley
description: A thrilling mystery novel set on a remote island during a wedding, where secrets unravel.

title: The Vanishing Half
author: Brit Bennett
description: A novel exploring the lives of two African American sisters who choose different paths in life.

title: The Last Thing He Told Me
author: Laura Dave
description: A suspenseful novel about a woman who unravels the mystery of her husband's disappearance.

title: The 5 Second Rule
author: Mel Robbins
description: A self-help book offering a simple tool to stop procrastination and boost confidence.

title: The Maid
author: Nita Prose
description: A quirky mystery novel featuring a hotel maid who becomes an amateur detective.

title: The Song of Achilles
author: Madeline Miller
description: A retelling of the ancient Greek myth of Achilles and Patroclus, exploring their deep bond.

title: It Ends With Us
author: Colleen Hoover
description: A contemporary romance novel exploring love, resilience, and the choices we make.

title: 12 Rules for Life
author: Jordan B. Peterson
description: A self-help book offering principles for a meaningful life, drawing on psychology and mythology.

title: People We Meet on Vacation
author: Emily Henry
description: A romance novel about two best friends who take summer vacations together and the feelings that develop.

title: Maybe You Should Talk to Someone
author: Lori Gottlieb
description: A therapist's memoir that explores her own therapy journey, as well as her patients' stories and transformations.

title: Where the Crawdads Sing
author: Delia Owens
description: A mystery and coming-of-age novel set in the marshes of North Carolina.

title: Educated
author: Tara Westover
description: A memoir about a woman who escapes her strict and abusive upbringing to pursue an education.

title: The Giver of Stars
author: Jojo Moyes
description: A historical fiction novel about a group of women who deliver library books on horseback in rural Kentucky.

title: American Dirt
author: Jeanine Cummins
description: A gripping novel about a mother and son's harrowing journey to escape violence in Mexico and seek refuge in the United States.

title: The Silent Patient
author: Alex Michaelides
description: A psychological thriller about a woman who murders her husband and never speaks again, and the psychotherapist determined to uncover the truth.

title: Normal People
author: Sally Rooney
description: A contemporary novel that explores the complex relationship between two Irish teenagers as they grow into adulthood.

title: Such a Fun Age
author: Kiley Reid
description: A thought-provoking novel that delves into issues of race, privilege, and social dynamics.

title: The Starless Sea
author: Erin Morgenstern
description: A fantasy novel that weaves together tales of magic, love, and adventure within a mysterious underground library.

title: The Dutch House
author: Ann Patchett
description: A family saga that follows the lives of two siblings and their connection to a grand, unusual house.
